instruction.value: Chew gum piece slowly and intermittently for 30 minutes.

additionalnotes.value: FIRST MONTH. Approximately one piece per hour is common for a pack a day smoker. Recommend 2 mg gum for patients with a score of 6 or less using the Fagerstrom nicotine tolerance scale.
SECOND MONTH. Recommend 2 mg gum for patients with a score of 6 or less using the fagerstrom nicotine tolerance scale.
THIRD MONTH. Recommend 2 mg gum for patients with a score of 6 or less using the fagerstrom nicotine tolerance scale.

FIRST MONTH. Approximately one piece per hour is common for a pack a day smoker. Recommend 4 mg gum for patients with a score of 7 or greater using the Fagerstrom nicotine tolerance scale OR for patients who have cravings while using the 2 mg strength gum.
SECOND MONTH. Recommend 4 mg gum for patients with a score of 7 or greater using the fagerstrom nicotine tolerance scale or for patients who have cravings while using the 2 mg strength gum.
THIRD MONTH. Recommend 4 mg gum for patients with a score of 7 or greater using the fagerstrom nicotine tolerance scale or for patients who have cravings while using the 2 mg strength gum.

backgroundinformation.value: Patient should not exceed 20 pieces of gum per day during first month.
